Parallel processing is an alternative to increase program performance. The interest in this area increases due to: -the limits imposed for the current technology that make it difficult to increase performance in sequential execution; -spread of parallel machines and, mainly, computer networks. This way, parallel and distributed processing are good alternatives to improve performance of costly applications. Besides, inherently distributed applications can be more easily implemented in distributed environments as network of computers. Explore distributed processing in network of computers has another advantage: most part of time CPUs are partially idle and these idle resources can be used to compute an expensive task. OPERA Project - Distributed Programming Environments - has been studing several aspects related to distributed processing. Initially, it was concerned only to implicit parallelism exploitation of logic languages. Nowadays it is open to all studies related to parallelism at application level.
